page.title: 08HOUSING/BUILDINGS NASH AREA
page.content: Planning authority consider this an area of no notation. Rural district with 2 settlements - Beachampton and Nash, therefore planning permission given only for in-filling or rounding off to village boundaries; development in countryside for agricultural purposes. Building concentrated along main village streets, very little side development. Housing an attractive mixture of old and new - every period over last 300 years represented. The modern brick house/bungalow is a detached 3/4 bedroom dwelling. Many older houses are listed buildings and have retained traditional stone or timber/brick appearance some thatched. Both villages have small pre-war council estates. Number of dwellings l36 excluding farms. Privately owned 94; rented-9; council rented-33.
